contentrichtext.text: {{for|the administrative subdivision of Iran|Honam Rural District}} {{Infobox Korean name| hangul={{linktext|호|남}}| hanja={{linktext|湖|南}}| mr=Honam| rr=Honam| }} '''Honam''' (literally "south of the lake") is a region coinciding with the former [[Jeolla]] Province in what is now [[South Korea]]. Today, the term refers to [[Gwangju]], [[South Jeolla]] and [[North Jeolla]] Provinces. The name "Honam" is used in the names of the [[Honam Line|Honam railway line]] and [[Honam Expressway]], which are major transportation corridors connecting [[Seoul]] and [[Daejeon]] to the Honam region. The name is often used to refer to people residing in the region. There is also [[Honam University]], which is located in [[Gwangju]], the capital of South Jeolla Province. ==See also== *[[Jeollabuk-do]] *[[Jeollanam-do]] *[[Gwangju]] *[[Regions of Korea]] *[[Yeongnam]] *[[List of Korea-related topics]] {{regions and administrative divisions of South Korea}} {{Korea-geo-stub}} [[Category:Regions of Korea]]
